alert.note: Alert for Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 07 at 2:53AM CST until March 07 at 3:30AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CST FOR NORTHEASTERN PHILLIPS AND SOUTHWESTERN TUNICA COUNTIES... At 253 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm producing a tornado was located 7 miles east of Watkins Corner, or 8 miles southeast of Marvell, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado, quarter size hail, and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Helena-West Helena, St Francis National Park, Lexa, Lake View, Huma, Preston Place, Quarles, Oneida, Barton, Wycamp, Latour, Kindall, Kingtown, Spring Creek, Trenton, Helena Crossing and Delta Heritage Trails State Park. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
